Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photo shows Barack Obama looking through binoculars the wrong way. The expert states that the image has been manipulated and provides evidence that Obama was actually looking through the correct end of the binoculars.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a manipulated image and does not provide any additional evidence to support the assertion that Obama was looking through the binoculars the wrong way.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Obama was looking through the binoculars the wrong way based solely on a manipulated image, without considering alternative explanations or additional evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides alternative explanations by stating that the image has been manipulated and presenting other photos from the same day where Obama is not holding the binoculars incorrectly.
